passage.title: What time is it?
passage.paragraph: John is six year old. He can read and write well, but he can't tell the time. He doesn't say eight o'clock , twelve o'clock, or four o'clock in the afternoon. He says breakfast-time, lunch-time or tea-time.
His aunt thinks she can teach him.
"Yes, One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten, eleven, twelve..."
"That's fine. Now, look at the clock, I put the long hand on twelve and the short hand on one - this is one o'clock. If I put the short hand on two, what's that?"
"Very good, boy. Now the short hand is on four," John's aunt looks at him and asks, "What time is it, John?"
